script:
Title: 'Long Way to the Top'

FADE IN:

EXT. SUBURBAN BACKYARD – DAY – EARLY 1960s

A toddler, COLIN (2), blonde, blue-eyed, slightly chubby, sits on a blanket in the grass banging on toy drums. The sun is shining. His mother, MRS. JONES (early 30s), watches lovingly from a lawn chair.

                        MRS. JONES (V.O.)
            From the moment he could hold a spoon, Colin wanted to be a rock star.

CUT TO:

INT. COLIN'S BEDROOM – NIGHT

Colin (5), now with messy, chin-length blonde hair, strums a plastic guitar, eyes closed, lost in the music from a small radio blaring AC/DC.

                        MRS. JONES (V.O.) (CONT'D)
            He loved the wild guitars, the pounding drums…

MONTAGE: (1960s)

- Colin (7), slightly chubby, hair a bit longer, bashes on pots and pans with chopsticks.
- Colin (10), messy hair, practices on a cheap electric guitar, posters of Led Zeppelin and The Beatles on his wall.
- Colin (12), nervously plays in the school talent show, his parents clapping in the audience.

CUT TO:

INT. GARAGE – EVENING – 1970s

Colin (16), now a teen, still chubby, messy shoulder-length blonde hair, jams with two friends. They’re loud, unpolished, but passionate. A homemade "The Thunderbolts" sign hangs crookedly behind them.

                        COLIN
            Let’s take it from the top!

Quick cuts:
- Colin singing into a hairbrush in the mirror, face serious.
- Colin practicing guitar until his fingers bleed.

CUT TO:

EXT. SMALL CLUB – NIGHT – 1980s

Colin (25), adult, slightly overweight, scruffy, shoulder-length hair, loads gear with new bandmates. Neon sign: "Metal Storm Tonight!"

INT. SMALL CLUB – LATER

The band plays to a nearly empty house. Colin sings his heart out, sweat dripping, hair plastered to his forehead.

                        COLIN (V.O.)
            Some nights it felt like no one cared. But I couldn’t stop.

CUT TO:

INT. APARTMENT – NIGHT

Colin (30), alone, scribbles lyrics in a notebook. He looks determined but tired. A Metallica poster hangs above his desk.

                        COLIN (V.O.) (CONT’D)
            For every door that closed, I wrote a new song.

MONTAGE: (1990s)

- Colin (35), slightly heavier, hair a bit shorter, rehearses with a new band, clashing egos.
- Colin (38), blue-eyed, smiling, performing at a wedding.
- Colin (40), frustrated, arguing with a bandmate, then sighing and packing up his guitar.

CUT TO:

INT. STUDIO – DAY – 2000s

Colin (45), still slightly chubby, now with shoulder-length, slightly thinning blonde hair, leads a group through a recording session. The band is tight, the sound is polished.

                        PRODUCER
            That’s the take! We’ve got it!

Colin beams. He exchanges high-fives with the band.

CUT TO:

EXT. CONCERT VENUE – NIGHT

A huge neon sign: "Rockfest 2005 – Main Stage."

INT. BACKSTAGE – NIGHT

Colin (46), a bit older, but still energetic, tunes his guitar. He looks in a mirror, adjusts his messy hair, and smiles nervously.

                        COLIN (V.O.)
            It took me forty years…

CUT TO:

INT. STAGE – NIGHT

Colin steps into the spotlight. The crowd roars. He launches into an electrifying performance.

SLOW MOTION:
Colin, blue-eyed, slightly chubby, shoulder-length blonde hair, sweat flying, fingerpicking his guitar, lost in the music.

ABOVE THE STAGE – NEON LIGHTS:

            "IT'S A LONG WAY TO THE TOP IF YOU WANT TO ROCK N ROLL."

Colin looks up, a tear in his eye, smiles and plays harder.

FADE OUT.

END.

storyboard.description: Colin (age 2), blonde, blue-eyed, slightly chubby, sits on a blanket in a sunlit suburban backyard, banging on toy drums. His hair is short and fluffy. His mother watches nearby.
Colin (5), messy chin-length blonde hair, blue eyes, slightly chubby, strums a plastic guitar in his bedroom at night. Posters of AC/DC on the wall, a radio playing.
Colin (7), chubby, longer messy blonde hair, blue eyes, enthusiastically bangs on pots and pans with chopsticks in the kitchen.
Colin (10), chubby, shoulder-length messy blonde hair, blue eyes, practices on a cheap electric guitar in his bedroom, Led Zeppelin and Beatles posters behind him.
Colin (12), chubby, shaggy blonde hair, blue eyes, nervously performs at a school talent show on a small stage, parents in the audience.
Colin (16), chubby, messy shoulder-length blonde hair, blue eyes, jams in a garage with his first band, 'The Thunderbolts', bandmates nearby.
Colin (16), same appearance, sings passionately into a hairbrush in front of a mirror.
Colin (16), same appearance, practices guitar intensely, fingertips bleeding, focused look.
Colin (25), adult, slightly overweight, scruffy, shoulder-length blonde hair, blue eyes, loads band gear into a van outside a club at night.
Colin (25), same appearance, on stage at a nearly empty club, lit by neon lights, singing energetically.
Colin (30), slightly heavier, shoulder-length messy blonde hair, blue eyes, sits alone in an apartment at night, writing lyrics at a desk with a Metallica poster above.
Colin (35), slightly heavier, shorter messy blonde hair, blue eyes, rehearses in a cluttered practice space with new bandmates, tensions evident.
Colin (38), similar build, short messy blonde hair, blue eyes, smiles as he performs at a wedding, people dancing in background.
Colin (40), slightly heavier, blue eyes, short messy blonde hair, frustrated, arguing with a bandmate in a rehearsal space.
Colin (40), same appearance, sighs and packs up his guitar alone.
Colin (45), slightly chubby, shoulder-length slightly thinning blonde hair, blue eyes, leads a band in a recording studio, looking confident.
Colin (45), same appearance, high-fives his bandmates after a successful take in the studio.
Colin (46), slightly chubby, shoulder-length slightly thinning blonde hair, blue eyes, stands backstage at a large concert venue, tuning his guitar.
Colin (46), same appearance, looks into a backstage mirror, adjusts his messy hair, and smiles nervously.
Colin (46), same appearance, stands in the wings, peers through the curtains at a roaring crowd under colorful lights.
Colin (46), same appearance, walks onto stage, guitar in hand, under bright concert lights, crowd cheering.
Colin (46), same appearance, stands center stage in a spotlight, blue eyes sparkling, ready to play.
Colin (46), same appearance, performs on stage, intensely focused, sweat flying, bandmates around him, crowd in the background.
Colin (46), same appearance, looks up at the neon sign above the stage that reads: 'It’s a long way to the top if you want to rock n roll.'
Colin (46), same appearance, smiles with a tear in his eye under the neon sign, lost in the music, triumphant finale.
